actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Armed Services.
Reported to House from the Committee on Armed Services, H. Rept. 94-1136.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Referred to Senate Committee on Armed Services.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Armed Services with amendment, S. Rept. 94-1238.

official_title: An Act to provide for additional income for the United States Soldiers' and Airmen's Home by requiring the Board of commissioners of such home to collect a fee from the members of such home and by increasing deductions for the support of such home from pay of enlisted men and warrant officers, and for other purposes.

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on Armed Services with amendment, S. Rept. 94-1238) Directs the Board of Commissioners of the United States Soldier's and Airmen's Home to collect from the members of the home a fee which may be used solely for the operation of the home. Requires that an amount, not to exceed 50 cents, be deducted each month from the pay of each enlisted man and warrant officer in the Regular Army and Regular Air Force and deposited to the credit of the United States Soldiers' and Airmens' Home Fund in the Treasury of United States. Repeals the Act entitled "An Act to provide further for the maintenance of the United States Soldiers' Home". Directs the Comptroller General of the United States to conduct a study of the operations of the United States Soldiers' and Airmens' Home.

titles.title: A bill to provide for additional income for the U.S. Soldiers' and Airmen's Home by  requiring the Board of Commissioners of the Home to collect a fee from the members of the Home; by appropriating nonjudicial forfeitures for support of the Home; and by increasing the deductions from pay of enlisted men and warrant officers.

An Act to provide for additional income for the United States Soldiers' and Airmen's Home by requiring the Board of commissioners of such home to collect a fee from the members of such home and by increasing deductions for the support of such home from pay of enlisted men and warrant officers, and for other purposes.
